member.name: T:OpenTK.IPackable`1
member.summary: Represents an item that can be packed with the TexturePacker.
member.typeparam: The type of the packable item.

member.name: M:OpenTK.TexturePacker`1.Add(`0,System.Drawing.Rectangle@)
member.summary: Packs the given item into the free space of the TexturePacker.
member.param: The item to pack.
member.returns: A System.Drawing.Rectangle containing the coordinates of the packed item.
member.exception: Occurs if the item is larger than the available TexturePacker area
Occurs if the item already exists in the TexturePacker.

member.name: M:OpenTK.TexturePacker`1.Clear
member.summary: Discards all packed items.

member.name: M:OpenTK.TexturePacker`1.ChangeSize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the dimensions of the TexturePacker surface.
member.param: The new width of the TexturePacker surface.
The new height of the TexturePacker surface.
member.remarks: Changing the size of the TexturePacker surface will implicitly call TexturePacker.Clear().

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader
member.summary: Encapsulates a sound stream and provides decoding and streaming capabilities.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new AudioReader that can read the specified sound file.
member.param: The path to the sound file.
member.returns: A new OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader, which can be used to read from the specified sound file.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new AudioReader that can read the specified soundstream.
member.param: The System.IO.Stream to read from.
member.returns: A new OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader, which can be used to read from the specified sound stream.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader.Supports(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: When overriden in a derived class, checks if the decoder supports the specified sound stream.
member.param: The System.IO.Stream to check.
member.returns: True if the sound stream is supported; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader.ReadSamples(System.Int64)
member.summary: When overriden in a derived class, reads and decodes the specified number of samples from the sound stream.
member.param: The number of samples to read and decode.
member.returns: An OpenTK.Audio.SoundData object that contains the decoded buffer.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader.ReadToEnd
member.summary: When overriden in a derived class, reads and decodes the sound stream.
member.returns: An OpenTK.Audio.SoundData object that contains the decoded buffer.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader.Dispose
member.summary: Closes the underlying Stream and disposes of the AudioReader resources.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReaderException
member.summary: Represents exceptions related to OpenTK.Audio.AudioReader objects.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReaderException.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new AudioReaderException.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.AudioReaderException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new AudioReaderException with the specified error message.
member.param: The error message of the AudioReaderException.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.WaveReader.Supports(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified stream contains valid WAVE/RIFF buffer.
member.param: The System.IO.Stream to check.
member.returns: True if the stream is a valid WAVE/RIFF file; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.WaveReader.ReadSamples(System.Int64)
member.summary: Reads and decodes the specified number of samples from the sound stream.
member.param: The number of samples to read and decode.
member.returns: An OpenTK.Audio.SoundData object that contains the decoded buffer.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Audio.WaveReader.ReadToEnd
member.summary: Reads and decodes the sound stream.
member.returns: An OpenTK.Audio.SoundData object that contains the decoded buffer.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.TextHandle
member.summary: Represents a handle to cached text.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextHandle.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new TextHandle,

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextHandle.ToString
member.summary: Returns a System.String that represents the current TextHandle.
member.returns: a System.String that descibes the current TextHandle.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextHandle.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the resource consumed by the TextHandle.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.TextHandle.Handle
member.summary: Gets the handle of the cached text run. Call the OpenTK.Graphics.ITextPrinter.Draw() method to draw the text represented by this TextHandle.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.TextHandle.Font
member.summary: Gets the TextureFont used for this text run.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.DisplayListTextPrinter
member.summary: Provides text printing through OpenGL 1.1 Display Lists.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.ITextPrinterImplementation
member.summary: Defines the interface for TextPrinter implementations.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ITextPrinterImplementation.Load(OpenTK.Math.Vector2[],System.UInt16[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Caches a text fragment for future use.
member.param: The vertex array for the text fragment.
The index array for the text fragment. Please use the indexCount parameter instead of indices.Count, as the indices array may be larger than necessary for performance reasons.
The actual number of indices in the text fragment.
member.returns: A TextHandle that can be used to draw the text fragment.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ITextPrinterImplementation.Draw(OpenTK.Graphics.TextHandle)
member.summary: Draws the specified cached text fragment.
member.param: The TextHandle corresponding to the desired text fragment.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.ITextPrinterImplementation.Draw(OpenTK.Math.Vector2[],System.UInt16[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a text fragment, without caching.
member.param: The vertex array for the text fragment.
The index array for the text fragment. Please use the indexCount parameter instead of indices.Count, as the indices array may be larger than necessary for performance reasons.
The actual number of indices in the text fragment.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph
member.summary: Represents a single character of a specific Font.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.#ctor(System.Char,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Constructs a new Glyph that represents the given character and Font.
member.param: The character to represent.
The Font of the character.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks whether the given object is equal (memberwise) to the current Glyph.
member.param: The obj to check.
member.returns: True, if the object is identical to the current Glyph.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.ToString
member.summary: Describes this Glyph object.
member.returns: Returns a System.String describing this Glyph.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.GetHashCode
member.summary: Calculates the hashcode for this Glyph.
member.returns: A System.Int32 containing a hashcode that uniquely identifies this Glyph.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Equals(OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph)
member.summary: Compares the current Glyph with the given Glyph.
member.param: The Glyph to compare to.
member.returns: True if both Glyphs represent the same character of the same Font, false otherwise.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Character
member.summary: Gets the character represented by this Glyph.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Font
member.summary: Gets the Font of this Glyph.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of this Glyph.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Rectangle
member.summary: Gets the bounding box of this Glyph.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Width
member.summary: Gets an integer representing the width of the Glyph in pixels.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Glyph.Height
member.summary: Gets an integer representing the height of the Glyph in pixels.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.#ctor(System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Constructs a new TextureFont, using the specified System.Drawing.Font.

member.summary: Constructs a new TextureFont, using the specified parameters.

The em size to use for the typeface.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.#ctor(System.Drawing.FontFamily,System.Single,System.Drawing.FontStyle)
member.summary: Constructs a new TextureFont, using the specified parameters.
member.param: The System.Drawing.FontFamily to use for the typeface.
The em size to use for the typeface.
The style to use for the typeface.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.LoadGlyphs(System.String)
member.summary: Prepares the specified glyphs for rendering.
member.param: The glyphs to prepare for rendering.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.LoadGlyph(System.Char)
member.summary: Prepares the specified glyph for rendering.
member.param: The glyph to prepare for rendering.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.GlyphData(System.Char,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Drawing.RectangleF@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the characteristics of a loaded glyph.
member.param: The character corresponding to this glyph.
The width of this glyph.
The height of this glyph (line spacing).
The bounding box of the texture buffer of this glyph.
The handle to the texture that contains this glyph.
member.returns: True if the glyph has been loaded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.MeasureString(System.String,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Measures the width of the specified string.
member.param: The string to measure.
The measured width.
The measured height.
If true, adds space to account for glyph overhangs. Set to true if you wish to measure a complete string. Set to false if you wish to perform layout on adjacent strings.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.MeasureString(System.String,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Measures the width of the specified string.
member.param: The string to measure.
The measured width.
The measured height.

seealso.cref: !:public void MeasureString(string str, out float width, out float height, bool accountForOverhangs)

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.MeasureText(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates size information for the specified text.
member.param: The string to measure.
member.returns: A RectangleF containing the bounding box for the specified text.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.MeasureText(System.String,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Calculates size information for the specified text.
member.param: The string to measure.
A SizeF structure containing the maximum desired width and height of the text. Default is SizeF.Empty.
member.returns: A RectangleF containing the bounding box for the specified text.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.MeasureText(System.String,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.StringFormat)
member.summary: Calculates size information for the specified text.
member.param: The string to measure.
A SizeF structure containing the maximum desired width and height of the text. Pass SizeF.Empty to disable wrapping calculations. A width or height of 0 disables the relevant calculation.
A StringFormat object which specifies the measurement format of the string. Pass null to use the default StringFormat (StringFormat.GenericTypographic).
member.returns: A RectangleF containing the bounding box for the specified text.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.MeasureText(System.String,System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.StringFormat,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.RectangleF})
member.summary: Calculates size information for the specified text.
member.param: The string to measure.
A SizeF structure containing the maximum desired width and height of the text. Pass SizeF.Empty to disable wrapping calculations. A width or height of 0 disables the relevant calculation.
A StringFormat object which specifies the measurement format of the string. Pass null to use the default StringFormat (StringFormat.GenericDefault).
Fills the specified IList of RectangleF structures with position information for individual characters. If this argument is null, these calculations are skipped.
member.returns: A RectangleF containing the bounding box for the specified text.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.PrepareTexturePacker
member.summary: Calculates the optimal size for the font texture and TexturePacker, and creates both.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.

member.summary: Gets a float indicating the default size of this font, in points.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureFont.Texture
member.summary: Gets the handle to the texture were this font resides.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Graphics.TextPrinterOptions.Default
member.summary: The TextPrinter will use default printing options.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Graphics.TextPrinterOptions.NoCache
member.summary: The TextPrinter will not cache text blocks as they are measured or printed.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.TextQuality
member.summary: Defines available quality levels for text printing.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Graphics.TextQuality.Default
member.summary: Use the default quality, as specified by the operating system.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Graphics.TextQuality.Low
member.summary: Use fast, low quality text (typically non-antialiased) .

member.name: F:OpenTK.Graphics.TextQuality.Medium
member.summary: Use medium quality text (typically grayscale antialiased).

member.name: F:OpenTK.Graphics.TextQuality.High
member.summary: Use slow, high quality text (typically subpixel antialiased).

member.name: T:OpenTK.Graphics.TextureRegion2D`1
member.summary: Holds part or the whole of a 2d OpenGL texture.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.Glyph.#ctor(System.Char,System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Constructs a new Glyph that represents the given character and Font.
member.param: The character to represent.
The Font of the character.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.Glyph.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks whether the given object is equal (memberwise) to the current Glyph.
member.param: The obj to check.
member.returns: True, if the object is identical to the current Glyph.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.Glyph.ToString
member.summary: Describes this Glyph object.
member.returns: Returns a System.String describing this Glyph.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.Glyph.GetHashCode
member.summary: Calculates the hashcode for this Glyph.
member.returns: A System.Int32 containing a hashcode that uniquely identifies this Glyph.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.Glyph.Character
member.summary: Gets the character represented by this Glyph.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.Glyph.Font
member.summary: Gets the Font of this Glyph.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.GlyphPacker.TryAdd(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle@)
member.summary: Adds boundingBox to the GlyphPacker.
member.param: The bounding box of the item to pack.
The System.Drawing.Rectangle that contains the position of the packed item.
member.returns: True, if the item was successfully packed; false if the item is too big for this packer..
member.exception: Occurs if the item is larger than the available TexturePacker area
Occurs if the item cannot fit in the remaining packer space.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.GlyphPacker.TryAdd(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.RectangleF@)
member.summary: Adds boundingBox to the GlyphPacker.
member.param: The bounding box of the item to pack.
The System.Drawing.RectangleF that contains the position of the packed item.
member.returns: True, if the item was successfully packed; false if the item is too big for this packer..
member.exception: Occurs if the item is larger than the available TexturePacker area
Occurs if the item cannot fit in the remaining packer space.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.GlyphPacker.Add(System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Adds boundingBox to the GlyphPacker.
member.param: The bounding box of the item to pack.
member.returns: A System.Drawing.Rectangle containing the coordinates of the packed item.
member.exception: Occurs if the item is larger than the available TexturePacker area
Occurs if the item cannot fit in the remaining packer space.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.GlyphPacker.Add(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Rounds boundingBox to the largest integer and adds the resulting Rectangle to the GlyphPacker.
member.param: The bounding box of the item to pack.
member.returns: A System.Drawing.Rectangle containing the coordinates of the packed item.
member.exception: Occurs if the item is larger than the available TexturePacker area
Occurs if the item already exists in the TexturePacker.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Graphics.Text.GlyphPacker.Clear
member.summary: Discards all packed items.
